1.effect_description: Gives a high number of appeal points wth no other effects.

2.effect_description: If the Pokémon that appealed before the user earned less than three appeal points, user earns six; if three, user earns three; if more than three, user earns none.
2.flavor_text: Affected by how well the appeal in front goes.

3.effect_description: If the user is jammed this turn after using this move, it will receive twice as many jam points.
3.flavor_text: After this move, the user is more easily startled.

4.effect_description: Attempts to jam the Pokémon that appealed before the user.
4.flavor_text: Badly startles the Pokémon in front.

5.effect_description: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.
5.flavor_text: Badly startles those that have made appeals.

6.effect_description: Attempts to jam the other Pokémon.  The user cannot make an appeal on the next turn, but it cannot be jammed either.
6.flavor_text: Jams the others, and misses one turn of appeals.

7.effect_description: User cannot make any more appeals for the remainder of the contest.
7.flavor_text: Makes a great appeal, but allows no more to the end.

8.effect_description: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.
8.flavor_text: Startles all Pokémon that have done their appeals.

9.effect_description: Attempts to jam the Pokémon that appealed before the user.
9.flavor_text: Startles the Pokémon that appealed before the user.

10.effect_description: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.  If a Pokémon is in combo standby status, it is jammed 5 points instead of 1.
10.flavor_text: Startles the Pokémon that has the judge’s attention.

11.effect_description: If the Applause meter is empty or at one, earns one point; if two, earns three points; if three, earns four points; if four, earns six points.
11.flavor_text: The appeal works best the more the crowd is excited.

12.effect_description: If the last Pokémon’s appeal is the same type as this move, user earns six points instead of two.
12.flavor_text: Works well if it’s the same type as the one before.

13.effect_description: Always adds a point to the applause meter, regardless of whether the move matches the contest, and can likewise gain the applause bonus.
13.flavor_text: An appeal that excites the audience in any contest.

14.effect_description: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn for half their appeal points (minimum 1).
14.flavor_text: Badly startles all Pokémon that made good appeals.

15.effect_description: Prevents jamming for the rest of this turn.
15.flavor_text: Can avoid being startled by others.

16.effect_description: Prevents the next jam on this turn.
16.flavor_text: Can avoid being startled by others once.

17.effect_description: Repeated use does not incur a penalty.
17.flavor_text: Can be repeatedly used without boring the judge.

18.effect_description: Attempts to make all following Pokémon nervous (and thus unable to appeal).
18.flavor_text: Makes all Pokémon after the user nervous.

19.effect_description: User earns appeal points equal to the points the previous Pokémon earned plus one.
19.flavor_text: Makes the appeal as good as the one before it.

20.effect_description: User earns appeal points equal to half the points ALL the previous Pokémon earned plus one.
20.flavor_text: Makes the appeal as good as those before it.

21.effect_description: Shuffles the next turn’s turn order.
21.flavor_text: Scrambles up the order of appeals on the next turn.

22.effect_description: Cancels combo standby status for all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.
22.flavor_text: Shifts the judge’s attention from others.

23.effect_description: Attempts to jam all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.  If a Pokémon used the same type move as this one, it is jammed for 4 points instead of 1.
23.flavor_text: Startles Pokémon that made a same-type appeal.

24.effect_description: Prevents the Applause Meter from rising for the rest of the turn.
24.flavor_text: Temporarily stops the crowd from getting excited.

25.effect_description: Randomly earns one, two, four, or eight points.
25.flavor_text: The appeal’s quality depends on its timing.

26.effect_description: If user appeals first this turn, earns one point; if second, two points; if third, four points; if last, six points.
26.flavor_text: The appeal works better the later it is performed.

27.effect_description: If user appeals first this turn, earns six points instead of two.
27.flavor_text: The appeal works great if performed first.

28.effect_description: If user appeals last this turn, earns six points instead of two.
28.flavor_text: The appeal works great if performed last.

29.effect_description: If user has no stars, earns one point; if one, three points; if two, five points; if three, seven points.  This does not include the appeal point bonus the stars give.
29.flavor_text: The appeal works well if the user’s condition is good.

30.effect_description: User will go first next turn.
30.flavor_text: The next appeal can be made earlier next turn.

31.effect_description: User will go last next turn.
31.flavor_text: The next appeal can be made later next turn.

32.flavor_text: Ups the user’s condition.  Helps prevent nervousness.

33.effect_description: Removes all stars from all Pokémon that have appealed this turn.
33.flavor_text: Worsens the condition of those that made appeals.
